sentences.sContent: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
sentences.sCn: 他猛地打开门，往楼下跑去。

sentences.sContent: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
sentences.sCn: 酒吧的门猛地弹开，冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。

sentences.sContent: All the windows were wide open (= completely open ).
She looked at the open suitcase with surprise.
sentences.sCn: 她惊讶地看着打开的手提箱。

sentences.sContent: There was an open bottle of wine on the table.
sentences.sCn: 桌上有一瓶打开的葡萄酒。

sentences.sContent: ...Leah’s growth spurred her to open her second studio— and it wasn’t for the money...
...Some people are absorbed in the past but not open to new memories...
...I didn’t need to open a second studio...
...It is like having these open wounds—they are just a part of you...
...we are not trying to assign blame or criticize anyone or call anyone conscious Its of this study to open up meaningful dialogues on implicit gender bias...
...I open the store when I want and leave when I want...
...Keep the same downwind window open while the engine is running...
...at the iPads and other tablets displayed around the hall like so many open boxes of candy...
...Keep a downwind window open slightly for fresh air...

synos.tran: [电]公开的；敞开的；空旷的；坦率的；营业着的

phrases.pCn: 打开；开发；开始；展示，揭露
空地；休憩用地；露天场所
开放政策；预定保险单；开口保险单
完全开放的，大开的；易受攻击的

words.tran: 开始；机会；通路；空缺的职位
[五金] 开启工具；开启的人

trans.tranOther: not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way
